messages.title: Working Hard In Parliament
messages.content: Zac has led campaigns against Heathrow expansion and for a ban on night flights, and has consistently campaigned for policies to support small businesses. Zac led the campaign to give voters Recall powers to make MPs more accountable and for a more democratic planning system.

messages.title: Standing Up For Our Community
messages.content: Zac is a champion for our community. Almost immediately after being elected, he opposed the introduction of parking charges in Richmond Park. He has campaigned to protect Kew Gardens from deep cuts securing additional funding, and he continues to lead the campaign for a long term and sustainable flood defense solution for the riverside towns of our area. Zac has pressed successfully for more school places and for action to tackle congestion, and is committed to returning the riverside service to its former glory. Zac has also forced two votes to stop MPs' rent being subsidised by taxpayers and to make government more transparent.

messages.title: A personal message for you
messages.content: It has been a huge privilege to represent the community I grew up in. Locally, I have been instrumental in reshaping and securing the future of our main emergency surgeries. I have also been rated among the top nine percent of MPs for individual constituency work. Nationally I have worked with my own Party to about a wide range of issues including environment and planning at a time when we are demanding more accountability and choice in how our communities are built and run. I would be grateful for your support on election day so I can continue campaigning on your behalf.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Zac has led campaigns against Heathrow expansion and for a ban on night flights.
Zac has consistently campaigned for policies to support small businesses.
Zac led the campaign to give voters Recall powers to make MPs more accountable and for a more democratic planning system.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Vince Cable; Labour and SNP; Miliband, Ed Balls, Harriet Harman; UKIP Noel
mentions.tacticalSituation: "Voting for UKIP will hand keys of No. 10 to Miliband, poll finds" - suggests voting for UKIP in this constituency could indirectly benefit the Labour Party.

issues.economy: "The deficit down Income tax cut More jobs New business" - suggests a focus on reducing the deficit, tax cuts, job creation, and new business support.
issues.education: Zac has pressed successfully for more school places.
issues.environment: Zac has opposed parking charges in Richmond Park, campaigned to protect Kew Gardens, and is involved in sustainable flood defense solutions.
issues.governance: Zac has made the government more transparent and has opposed MPs' rent subsidy by taxpayers.
issues.health: Zac has been instrumental in reshaping and securing the future of main emergency surgeries.

leaflet.personalStatement: It has been a huge privilege to represent the community I grew up in.

politicalExperience.achievements: Instrumental in local health services, highly rated for constituency work, led campaigns for local and national issues such as environment and democratic reforms.

quotes.text: Zac has proved himself a politician of principle - Evening Standard
Backbench Politician of the Year - Politic & Public Life Awards
Zac sets the standard of what politicians should aspire to - Michael Gove
